title: Catherine's Spicy Chicken Soup Recipe
description: A shredded chicken soup flavored with garlic, onion powder, salsa, tomatoes, tomato soup, chili powder, corn, beans and sour cream. Serve with tortilla chips.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes Soup Recipes Chicken Soup Recipes Catherine's Spicy Chicken Soup 4.8 (2,439) 1,685 Reviews 135 Photos This is a great recipe that you can fix to your taste! The longer it simmers the better. Top with crushed tortilla chips and shredded cheese. Enjoy! Submitted by AUNTTAF Updated on October 11, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 135 135 135 135 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 1 hr 30 mins Total Time: 1 hr 45 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 2 quarts water 8 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves ½ teaspoon salt 1 teaspoon ground black pepper 1 teaspoon garlic powder 2 tablespoons dried parsley 1 tablespoon onion powder 5 cubes chicken bouillon 3 tablespoons olive oil 1 onion, chopped 3 cloves garlic, chopped 1 (16 ounce) jar chunky salsa 2 (14.5 ounce) cans peeled and diced tomatoes 1 (14.5 ounce) can whole peeled tomatoes 1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed tomato soup (such as Campbell’s) 3 tablespoons chili powder 1 (15 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained 2 (16 ounce) cans chili beans, undrained 1 (8 ounce) container sour cream Directions In a large pot over medium heat, combine water, chicken, salt, pepper, garlic powder, parsley, onion powder and bouillon cubes. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer 1 hour, or until chicken juices run clear. Remove chicken, reserve broth. Shred chicken. In a large pot over medium heat, cook onion and garlic in olive oil until slightly browned. Stir in salsa, diced tomatoes, whole tomatoes, tomato soup, chili powder, corn, chili beans, sour cream, shredded chicken and 5 cups broth. Simmer 30 minutes. Jessica I Made It Print 2,479 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Catherine's Spicy Chicken Soup 01 of 135 Photo by  Jessica 02 of 135 Photo by  Bill Mattox 05/10/2021 03 of 135 Photo by  Catherine Salazar 02/18/2021 Our absolute favorite soup. It is a fan favorite when we are camping with friends. I add an extra can of corn and we eat it with tortillas. It isn’t spicy for us, but it explodes with flavor! Absolutely delicious! 04 of 135 Photo by  Patsy Yates 01/09/2021 I did it one pot sautéed the onion and garlic then added everything else it just takes 20 mins then, delicious 05 of 135 Photo by  RandyMac 11/06/2020 06 of 135 Photo by  Sherry Davis 01/20/2020 07 of 135 Photo by  Bill Harlin 01/11/2020 08 of 135 Photo by  Leah 10/31/2019 09 of 135 Photo by  ken k 10/19/2019 10 of 135 Photo by  kevin Holt 10/16/2019 Absolutely fantastic recipe.All the flavors come together in such great harmony.Perfect for a chilly day! 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Instant Pot® Mexican Chicken Soup 3 Ratings Creamy Chicken Tortilla Soup with RO*TEL 1 Rating Spicy Chicken and Hominy Mexican Soup 13 Ratings Instant Pot Chicken and Vegetable Tortilla Soup 1 Rating Southwest Cheesy Chicken Enchilada Soup 1 Rating Easy Chicken Fajita Soup 365 Ratings Low-Carb Mexican Chicken Soup 1 Rating Chicken Enchilada Soup 509 Ratings Chicken Tortilla Soup in the Instant Pot 8 Ratings Southwest Black Bean Chicken Soup 86 Ratings Mexican Soup 96 Ratings Chipotle Pepper and Chicken Soup 5 Ratings Chicken Enchilada Slow Cooker Soup 431 Ratings Hearty Chicken Enchilada Soup 17 Ratings Chicken Tortilla Soup IV 223 Ratings Easy Chicken Pozole 218 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: AUNTTAF
instructions: In a large pot over medium heat, combine water, chicken, salt, pepper, garlic powder, parsley, onion powder and bouillon cubes. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer 1 hour, or until chicken juices run clear. Remove chicken, reserve broth. Shred chicken.;In a large pot over medium heat, cook onion and garlic in olive oil until slightly browned. Stir in salsa, diced tomatoes, whole tomatoes, tomato soup, chili powder, corn, chili beans, sour cream, shredded chicken and 5 cups broth. Simmer 30 minutes. Jessica
